content: This is the sort of thing that mostly resounds into an echo chamber. “Lynch” has been used in this context for an extremely long time — if it is a buzz word, it is a very tired one. Most Americans probably don’t know what a pillory is any more — but they do know lynching. Unless a word is specifically and intentionally derogatory to a group, attempts to curb your fellow’s speech is just as likely to inflame it. If you really care about this, then target the committee behind the AP Stylebook or Chicago Manual of Style. But even then, many previous reputable new sources use clickbait style sensationalism and ignore good taste.
